titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 586) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that the exclusion from gross income for foster care payments shall also apply to payments by qualified placement agencies, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-412, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

It shall be in order to take from the Speaker's table H.R. 586 and the Senate amendment thereto, and to consider in the House without intervention of any point of order a motion to concur in the Senate amendment with an amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution. The Senate amendment and the motion shall be considered as read. The motion shall be debatable for one hour.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 143.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 390.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 206 (Roll no. 101).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 218 - 205 (Roll no. 102).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/17/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 586 (fairness for foster care families and tax relief guarantee).
